Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk python-rhsm
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: subscription-manager bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The subscription-manager packages provide programs and libraries to allow users to manage subscriptions and yum repositories from the Red Hat entitlement platform. The subscription-manager-migration-data packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.0.18, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1146986) This update also fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, changes to repository configuration in the /etc/yum.repos.d/redhat.repo file made manually or using yum-config-manager were overwritten by the subscription-manager yum plug-in. This bug has been fixed, and the subscription-manager yum plug-in no longer overwrites user-defined changes. (BZ#1098891) Previously, unexpected server problems could lead to replies to subscription-manager that were not JSON-formatted. This in turn caused subscription-manager to log traceback errors. As a consequence, subscription-manager appeared to be working incorrectly even though the error was only in the server. With this update, subscription-manager has been fixed to handle network errors gracefully. Network errors and non-JSON responses from the server are now filtered and logged as expected. (BZ#1167463) The subscription-manager yum plugin rewrote the redhat.repo file with each yum transaction, despite the fact that no changes have been made. Consequently, because of a change in the last modification time of redhat.repo, yum reloaded the metadata, which caused an unnecessary performance delay. With this update, the redhat.repo file is no longer being re-written unnecessarily during execution of the yum subscription-manager plugin, thus avoiding the performance delay. (BZ#1104731) Previously, the rhsm-debug utility did not correctly handle timeouts. Consequently, the sosreport and abrt utilities did not collect debug information. With this update, rhsm-debug handles timeouts gracefully, so that sosreport and abrt collect debug information as expected. (BZ#1093325) In addition, this update adds the following enhancements: The subscription-manager manual page has been enhanced to correctly describe the --consumerid option. (BZ#1122107) With this update, new systemd-rpm macros have been introduced to the subscription-manager spec file. (BZ#850331) The output of the 'subscription-manager subscribe --auto' command has been enhanced to inform the user if it was unable to find available subscriptions for all installed products. (BZ#864195) This update adds the rhsm.conf(5) manual page to subscription-manager packages. (BZ#990183) When using subscription-manager to register from the command line to an entitlement server that supports environments, no prompt was given for the environment, even though interactive prompts for username, password, and organization worked as expected. This update adds the interactive prompt for environments. (BZ#1065158) This update adds the --matches option to the "subscription-manager list" command, which enables searching for user-defined text in returned entries. Also, the --pool-only option has been added to easily attach to pools matching the string specified in --matches. (BZ#1146125, BZ#1159974) With this update, and appropriate message is displayed when subscription-manager list commands find results. (BZ#1151925) Users of subscription-manager are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
